solution_line_template: Making {pencils_per_day} pencils a day, he made {pencils_per_day} pencils/day * {work_days_per_week} days/week = <<{pencils_per_day}*{work_days_per_week}={pencils_made_during_week}>>{pencils_made_during_week} pencils during the week.

With the pencils from the stock, he got {pencils_made_during_week} pencils + {initial_stock} pencils = <<{pencils_made_during_week}+{initial_stock}={total_pencils_before_sale}>>{total_pencils_before_sale} pencils.

Subtracting the ones he sold, he has {total_pencils_before_sale} pencils - {pencils_sold} pencils = <<{total_pencils_before_sale}-{pencils_sold}={pencils_at_end_of_week}>>{pencils_at_end_of_week} pencils.
